text.content:
A feat represents an area of expertise that gives a character special capabilities. It embodies training, experience, and abilities beyond what a class provides.

At certain levels, your class gives you the Ability Score Improvement feature. You can forgo taking that feature to take a feat, often referred to as a parent feat, of your choice instead. You can take each parent feat only once, unless the feat's description says otherwise.

You must meet any prerequisite specified in a feat to take that feat. If you ever lose a feat's prerequisite, you cannot use that feat until you regain the prerequisite. For example, the Savage Combatant feat requires you to have a Strength of 13 or higher. If your Strength is reduced below 13 somehow -- perhaps by a withering curse -- you cannott benefit from the Savage Combatant feat until your Strength is restored.

Whenever you choose a feat, you may pick any three of the features listed, referred to as bullets or bullet points. A bullet may only be selected once, unless the description says otherwise. Whenever you gain a level, you may change one of your bullet selections from one feat you have choosen. Feats are listed below.

Feat at Level 1

In Materia all players begin with a feat at level 1. This is to help propel them into the fantasy they wish to fulfill. Check with your Dungeon Master if you are not playing in Materia to see if this is the case, but we highly recommend they allow you to do so.

Half Feat Variant

Your Dungeon Master may allow you to forgo two of your three feature selections from any given feat to instead receive a +1 to an ability score of your choice. Doing so permanently locks in the +1 ability score increase and you can only ever have one bullet from the parent feat.

Species Feat Variant

Your Dungeon Master may allow you to forgo one of your feature selections from any given parent feat to instead replace it with one that matches your character's species. You may never have more than one species feat bullet within any given parent feat. Species feat bullets can be changed like with other bullets within the parent feat when you gain a level as per usual.

You cannot take a Half Feat with a Species Feat. You can find Species Feats below.

Prerequisite: Dexterity 13 or higher

Your exceptional readiness and nimble nature grant you advantages magnified by your eager and brisk approach.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.lHsNvDfX4g8Mjy48]{Adaptive Assault.} When you deal damage with a weapon attack that benefits from the Deft weapon property, you may deal additional damage of the weapon's type equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vER9H5t8h2RDIMHM]{Alert.} You cannot have Disadvantage on Initiative rolls unless you have the &Reference[Incapacitated] condition.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9GDomDYSpAnug042]{Brisk Combat.} When a hostile creature within reach of your melee attacks or Unarmed Strike is reduced to 0 hit points, you can take a Reaction to move up to half your Speed and make an additional melee attack or Unarmed Strike against a different creature within range.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Bf9KJ4B0k8X3Jzi4]{Cavort.} You do not require a running start to jump max distances or height. Furthermore, taking fall damage does not knock you &Reference[Prone apply=false], unless you wish it to.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jZsx5vkfAGRYeW7J]{Close the Gap.} If you hold your Attack action, you can move up to your Speed as part of the Reaction.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.XgyoMFdWJPTuUKT2]{Dexterous Adaptability.} If you do not take the Attack action on your turn, you can use your Bonus Action to make one weapon attack or Unarmed Strike on that same turn. You cannot make this attack with a weapon that has the Heavy property.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4LtlKh00oGIzwn57]{Enhanced Balance.} You can move through a hostile creature's space only if the creature is at least one size larger. Additionally, moving through a hostile creature's space is not &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jJ3yPPjYbTGYZ5m0]{Fleet.} Your Speed increases by 10 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.a8gHutCmFOrjp0k9]{Light Footed.} &Reference[Difficult Terrain] does not cost you extra movement.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jpXM64vbR0MZHZyu]{Nimble.} Standing up from &Reference[Prone apply=false] uses only 5 feet of your movement. You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed. You can make a running long or high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pIcJVa9HHdpEkSk7]{Parkour.} You can use your Dexterity in place of Strength with Climbing and Jumping, and you can fall 5 times your Proficiency Bonus feet before taking any fall damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.EeijBtRDWRSO2mHv]{Swift Approach.} When you start your turn within Cover you Speed is increased by an amount of feet equal to 5 times your Proficiency Bonus.

You have studied the use of armor, and have improved your ability to use armor effectively.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.WZU13w30mDg0INqM]{Armor Mastery.} While you are wielding a shield, wearing medium armor or heavy armor you are proficient in, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical weapons is reduced by your proficiency bonus. If you are wielding a magical shield, wearing magical medium armor or magical heavy armor (of any type) damage reduction applies to all bludgeoning, piercing or slashing weapons.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.VRe74oOdqpUd7Yt9]{Armor Mobility.} While wearing light armor or medium armor that does not impose disadvantage on your Dexterity (Stealth) checks, opportunity attacks are made against you with disadvantage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.IuChtc8R9y9Ur7PM]{Armored Agility.} When you wear medium armor you are proficient in, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.oXJJcSe2UJT9GhzS]{Armored Stealth.} Wearing medium or heavy armor which you are proficient in does not impose disadvantage on your Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.tw8qsoChAnAj6baA]{Heavy Armor Mobility.} You may ignore the minimum Strength requirement of heavy armor you are proficient in.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.hryFf8tIZWL2GCdV]{Heavy Armor Momentum.} While you are wearing Heavy Armor you can use your Strength modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier for your initiative rolls. If your Dexterity modifier is negative than you must include the negative amount to your initiative.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4zvKPC0EuBRWBY6d]{Heavy Armor Proficiency.} You gain proficiency in heavy armor (you must be proficient in medium armor from a source other than this feat to choose this bullet).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pEXnXsVO5OUzyqBH]{Light Armor Defense.} While wearing light armor, you may add your armor's AC bonus to your Dexterity saving throws.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Lt3b1Nuox7YtOfUz]{Light Armor Mastery.} While wearing light armor which you are proficient in, and you are damaged by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to move 5 feet in any direction without provoking an opportunity attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.5QrC8sgH0AKzgMvW]{Light Armor Proficiency.} You gain proficiency in light armor.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.fWzhiVwNT4hBRXGw]{Light Armor Versatility.} You may wear a Hauberk armor, Hide armor, or Mail Shirt as light armor for the sake of determining proficiency. When wearing a Hauberk armor, Hide armor, or Mail Shirt, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.tMCZjlUmXhKHlu0z]{Medium Armor Adaptability.} When you wear medium armor you are proficient in, you can use your Constition rather than your Dexterity for the additional armor normally provided by Dexterity.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.NG7rCQSmN3ZxbFEr]{Medium Armor Proficiency.} You gain proficiency in medium armor (you must be proficient in light armor through a source other than this feat to choose this bullet).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.gNXKX33CuKC08kDl]{Shield Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with bucklers, shields and tower shields.

Prerequisite: Ability to cast at least one spell or an ability that takes a Magic action

Your magic has been honed to use in combat, your quick thinking and specialized training provide certain advantages while fighting with spells.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.XlDS5IvS3xz4Y3uP]{Battlecaster.} When a hostile creature's movement provokes an Opportunity Attack from you, you can use take a Reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an Opportunity Attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

  • Elemental Adept. Choose one of the following damage types: @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.1LWhDaPD6YG5tqEj]{Acid}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.LSxWV4rvIssJWuXf]{Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.34m4Iz9vLZ8HrEC4]{Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cttBhuVhld8ItZAo]{Lightning}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.3OGQYAhlzGTbdwli]{Poison} or @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.81N46hup2Ao21qbQ]{Thunder}. Spells you cast ignore Resistance to damage of the chosen type, and creatures with Immunity to the damage type selected may be damaged as if they had Resistance instead. You may select this bullet more than once with your three selections, if you do so you choose a different damage type.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.dJ2yW5rN0bT0lC6M]{Hardy Concentration.} You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your Concentration on a spell when you take damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.inOKYUG3pnxtBuja]{Metamagic Adept.} You learn one Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class. You can use this Metamagic option on any spell you can cast of a level equal to your Proficiency Bonus or lower. You regain the expended Metamagic when you finish a long rest. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one of these Metamagic options with another one from the Sorcerer class. This bullet may be selected more than once (which can be the same Metamagic option).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zVaMOt8qLFOujLt9]{Mystical Overload.} On your turn, before you make a melee spell attack or ranged spell attack, you can choose to forgo your Proficiency Bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your Proficiency Bonus to the damage. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.lZQvahTSCRPmqk2p]{second time}, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your Proficiency Bonus to the attack roll, adding twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kncPA2BcD9fWEgjd]{Punishing Magic.} When you deal a Critical Hit with a spell attack or a creature rolls a 1 on a Saving Throw against spell you cast and takes damage, gain a Heroic Inspiration. The spell must be cast using a spell slot.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.a6RUMI4iRRfFiCyt]{Reliable Spells.} When you roll damage or healing for a spell you cast, you can treat any 1 on a damage die or healing die as a 2. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.W8n73I2NRiilnxgM]{second time}, you treat any 1 as the maximum result on the die instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.N5RghhMHDqMgGGrb]{Salvage Spells.} When you hold a spell for a certain trigger to be met, if that trigger does not occur, your spell slot and any material components are not consumed.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.rbeTIEhYJMV5lfJX]{Spell Accuracy.} Your melee spell attacks and ranged spell attacks ignore &Reference[Half Cover] and &Reference[Three-Quarters Cover]. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature does not impose Disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.GCHIcisQn85LVlS4]{Spell Sniper.} When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled. If the spell's attack range is at least 10 feet, then the minimum new range is 30 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.BvBu8AwKVpA4xR9y]{Warcaster.} You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a buckler, shield or tower shield in one or both hands.

Prerequisite: Dexterity 13 or higher

You are especially quick and nimble, and this provides you with benefits in your movement and reactions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8cNu8v8UEcsVTO6t]{Combat Mobility.} You may take the Disengage action as a bonus action. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.z5gTktsRXbiwv0tT]{second time}, your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from creatures you can see.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Gfzti93JOrEL2Bj8]{Escape Artist.} You can attempt to escape against an escape DC as a bonus action. Additionally, anytime the creature that imposes the escape DC against you takes damage, you can use your reaction to attempt to escape.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.3niuJzh3pXBoZnmR]{Fast Reflexes.} You gain a bonus to initiative equal to your proficiency bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.k2JUz3JXhrRmtVyZ]{Flow of Combat.} When you miss with an attack of opportunity made with a weapon you are proficient with or unarmed strike, you do not lose your reaction.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.PY3ZWbDjNaQoFXlH]{Initiative Swap.} Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can swap your Initiative with the Initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You can't make this swap if you or the ally has the Incapacitated condition.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Ov7Jr5wMjMGcfRvJ]{Instinctive Attack.} You can make an opportunity attack without having to see a hostile creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ZVbcmQXM4cwYbeXv]{Keen Awareness.} While you have cover, ranged attacks made against you are done at disadvantage while you are concious and have a speed greater than 0.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vp4CigD2dFdETpsl]{Reflexive.} When use your action to Dodge action on your turn, you can make one weapon attack or unarmed strike as part of the same action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.p9vXBJAtkdqMF0Qu]{Sudden Pains.} f you are adding additional dice to a damage roll (such as after scoring a critical hit or a sneak attack) from an attack with a weapon with the Finesse property, you can reroll a number of dice equal to your proficiency bonus and take the higher result.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iKf2cfW1ZOwnTXV1]{Uncanny Dodge.} When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend one of your Hit Dice to halve the attack's damage against you as long as you are not wearing heavy armor.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zW5UMvOaTBwFKFL7]{Uncanny Senses.} Other creatures do not gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.GQqNTveZz3VB0hni]{Unerring.} The first attack roll you make with advantage on your turn that you are proficient in, you add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll again.

You have manifested some of the power of the awe inspiring and frightening dragons, granting you a broad array of potential benefits.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ZsHifmwB0k7rWH93]{Blood of the Drake.} When you have no more than half of your Hit Points left and regain Hit Points from a level 1+ spell, or by expending Hit Dice, you regain additional Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YFAP2fIG6zNxba4Q]{Chromatic Infusion.} As a Bonus Action, you can touch a simple, martial, or natural weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. For the next minute, the weapon or Unarmed Strike deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits. After you use this Bonus Action, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest or expend one Hit Die (no action required).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.0LPjB6FdsYC8b3pQ]{Dragon Roar.} Once on your turn, when you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can immediately let out a powerful roar. A number of creatures equal to your Proficiency Bonus of your choice within 30 feet of you that can hear you take Force damage equal to twice your Proficiency Bonus. Each creature can only take damage from any Dragon Roar once per turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vtGA5KoYTdWd2pFK]{Dragon Wrath.} Once on each of your turns, when you use your Weapon Mastery on a creature, you can deal Force damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ywloVmU3iq6SgxiJ]{Great Luster.} When a creature uses their Heroic Inspiration and you do not have one, gain a Heroic Inspiration.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.JJY3YeT4ymw3nzVU]{Protective Wings.} You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use take a Reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your Proficiency Bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can do this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ot8NivmcZdXiPpfQ]{Reactive Resistance.} When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage, you can take a Reaction to give yourself Resistance to that instance of damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aGQannsab4axKAOQ]{Sweeping Tail.} As a Bonus Action, you can manifest a spectral tail as a natural weapon and immediately attack with it. If you hit with the tail, you deal Force damage equal to 1d6 plus your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you manifest the tail), instead of the Bludgeoning damage normal for an Unarmed Strike. Furthermore, if there are creatures within 5 feet of your initial target for your tail attack, you can deal Force damage equal to the modifier you chose when attacking them.

    You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest. You can regain a use of this Bonus Action by expending a Hit Die (no action required).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.gvddG9HaoHvTxJcF]{Wyrm Sense.} The ranges of your special senses, such as Darkvision, Truesight, the ability to sense magic through the Detect Magic spell, a Paladin's Divine Sense, and other similar effects are increased by 30 feet. If any of your special senses has a range of less than 30 feet, its range is doubled instead.

You are a master of fighting with two weapons at once. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing two weapon fighting.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.g2brjkWx3UV9dgRW]{Bonus Attacks.} You may use your bonus action to make an attack with a weapon you are holding on your turn as long as you made a weapon attack with a different weapon you are holding, even if you did not take the Attack Action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YLV8Tw6IjMqIwpmn]{Defensive Dual Wielder.} You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.M7PACPCjLAPKfCV5]{Flurry.} When you make an attack of opportunity with a weapon you are holding, you can make another weapon attack with a separate weapon you are holding as part of the same attack of opportunity against the same target. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.i9fVOVtIBD41eQpz]{second time}, you can make the additional attack against any target within the weapon's reach.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aSCOjTpr3Sn7JAkq]{Gauche.} When you take the Attack action on your turn and are wielding separate melee weapons in each hand, you can declare that all of your attacks on your turn will be against a single target. For all of the attacks that hit, you can total all of the damage and hit the target all at once rather than once per attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.QDCRK0c8C6fe7N9U]{Heavy Dual Wielder.} You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding are not light.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ChMTZ78IvQPAn1RP]{Mirrored Assault.} While you are wielding a separate weapon in each hand, you treat both weapons as having the finesse property as long as either of the weapons have the property.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YaJIQXFdWvKChadr]{Multi Attacker.} When you use a bonus action to attack using two weapon fighting, you may make an additional attack with that weapon if you made more than one attack with another weapon you are holding on that turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vHEhx9zZIswKQ8Jq]{Paired Weapons.} When you miss a melee weapon attack while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand, you can immediately use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack with the opposite weapon you are holding.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vB63AVPt2vNbGBj2]{Quick Dual Wielding.} Whenever you use your interact with an object to draw or stow a weapon, you may do so with two one handed weapons at the same time. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.BS8p1lSUKOJ00buS]{second time}, you may also stow an object you are holding as part of the same interaction.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.tn1mRStwwa8BF1Li]{Relentlessness.} When you succeed on an ability check or saving throw to avoid or end a Condition on yourself, you can make one weapon attack with one of the weapons you are holding if you are wielding a separate weapon in each hand. The weapon attack must be made against a target within range of your weapon.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.MXI8o30Rx8b8ZopZ]{Twisting Strikes.} On your turn, when you score a critical hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a one-handed weapon while you are wielding a separate weapon in each hand, your next attack with the opposite weapon is made with advantage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.VkqDNKaqjrRzgp55]{Weapon Versatility.} You gain proficiency in three one handed weapons of your choice.

Feats

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaAlacrity00]{Alacrity} (@UUID[.Bh6Bl9e8zLexnl9C]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaArmorSpeci]{Armor Specialist} (@UUID[.bbNjY5J4Fl9sXq1N]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaBattleMagi]{Battle Magic} (@UUID[.6741PurwYMqSZjiZ]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaCombatRefl]{Combat Reflexes} (@UUID[.ooWxLSRsdzZ4aQjo]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaDualWeapon]{Dual Weapon Specialist} (@UUID[.wsCVES0097XAl6LR]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSkillSpeci]{Educated} (@UUID[.PsejNcPq2DaICA9Z]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaMagicalTra]{Magical Training} (@UUID[.sNUwe6tPojv6neNc]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaMountedCom]{Mounted Combat Specialist} (@UUID[.tBACTV3Au0WzNBfx]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaNaturalWea]{Natural Weapon Specialist} (@UUID[.ct99lFH6axPyXsmR]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaPracticedC]{Practiced Combatant} (@UUID[.WxwhC9czNIYEneOo]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaPsiTouched]{Psi-Touched} (@UUID[.4V1VC5L7UAlWoxYP]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaRangedComb]{Ranged Combat Specialist} (@UUID[.ZZeHkm0aaju6s0la]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaScaleborn0]{Scaleborn} (@UUID[.IPRjMUtxhCJ7YHKg]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSavageComb]{Savage Combatant} (@UUID[.Ruy7nokZzsSLtaqp]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSharpIntel]{Sharp Intellect} (@UUID[.lmszoZjYx9XnuoHT]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSingleHand]{Single Handed Weapon Specialist} (@UUID[.cY6PnvRqvRxGCMdR]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSkulker000]{Skulker} (@UUID[.8DiuagSfQjuNK7Pm]{description and bullet options})

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.matFeaSurvivor00]{Survivor} (@UUID[.N401nDzWItWlcW0I]{description and bullet options})

Half-Feats

Species Feats

  • @UUID[.qmxSCWV5ue2XhNuJ]{Species Feats descriptions and bullet options}

You have studied with a capable teacher, or at a college, perhaps learning lore, languages, or perhaps learning other skills through a mentor.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.SlpfN4upg7reMFI1]{Coder.} You can ably create written ciphers. Others cannot decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it. Your spellbook, if you have one, may be written in such ciphers preventing it from being copied by anyone who you have not taught the cypher to.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.PM0r9mgBheJpmUBd]{Expert Education.} Gain expertise in a skill or tools for which you are proficient.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.I0qiNuF3wceGVFkR]{Linguist.} You learn three languages of your choice. Your understanding of communication allows you to communicate with a creature who speaks a language you do not know on a rudimentary level after 10 minutes of interaction. In addition you may decipher a written language you do not know on a rudimentary level after 10 minutes of study.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.dnOz7nNs6qABJiu4]{Skill Training.} Gain proficiency in a skill in which you are not proficient. This bullet may be selected more than once.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pRTgrG8XTV0gU72F]{Studied.} You gain advantage on any intelligence ability check to recall information about a type of creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.OMUtgMZMx5xEiXvP]{Tool Training.} Gain proficiency in three sets of tools for which you are not proficient. You may add half your proficiency modifier on any ability check to use a set of tools for which you are not proficient.

You have learned the basics of magic, either through a teacher, or on your own initiative. This has given you rudimentary magic skills and/or the training to deal with spellcasters.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jPKkOxQ7HxippXdy]{Cantrip Adept.} Any cantrip with a casting time of 1 action that does not make an attack roll, use attacks as part of the spell's effect, or impose a saving throw can be cast as a Bonus Action instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.6J9E4Tw9pK1Kj67I]{Eldritch Adept.} You learn one non-Pact Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the Warlock class. If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you are a Warlock who meets the prerequisite. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the Warlock class.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.PfMeTbfbDcA0YY8E]{Hedge Magic.} Choose 2 cantrips from any one spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat). You may select this bullet more than once.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.wVfHkL9epY8MfTQb]{Mage Slayer.} When a creature within reach of a melee weapon you are holding or your Unarmed Strike casts a spell or takes a Magic action, you can take a Reaction to make a melee attack with the same weapon you are holding or your Unarmed Strike against that creature. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.2QWgJ353K1Xck2G9]{second time} and the attack hits, the spell is lost.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8ggtMBQTiKYL6MbS]{Magical Adept.} Choose a Level 1 spell from any spell list. You learn that spell and always it prepared. You can cast it at its lowest level without using a spell slot. Once you cast it in this way, you cannot cast it in this way again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace the spell you chose for this feat with a different Level 1 spell from the chosen spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat). You may select this bullet more than once.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.M3bR7Lgk2PuBt0sB]{Magical Adroitness.} You are able to maintain cantrips that normally require Concentration without the need to maintain Concentration. You can have a number of these cantrip effects active at any one given time equal to your Proficiency Bonus (minimum of 1).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Y5diR32TdbwLRNEA]{Magical Implement.} You gain proficiency with one type of Artisan's Tools of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kU13ZqTqHsfrxj3F]{Magical Parry.} When you are targeted by an attack from a Magic action or spell, you can take a Reaction to add your Proficiency Bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cuglRuHdRjtFRu0k]{Rapid Ritual.} When you cast a spell with a duration of Instantaneous as a ritual spell, the casting time is shortened to one minute.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cP1NR2b1Ywa26MHb]{Ritual Adept.} When you cast a spell as a Ritual, you are not required to maintain Concentration during the casting.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.IlP8kzBtI5JLSjEC]{Ritual Caster.} Choose two level 1 spells equal that have the Ritual tag. You always have those spells prepared, and you can cast them with any spell slots you have. The spells' spellcasting ability is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this bullet). If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.eoUDU8zNMhHIipZd]{second time}, you may also select a level 2 spell with the Ritual tag from the same class that you may cast as a Ritual.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.AvDnSACW5Xf6gHpv]{Snap Preparation.} Once per day when you finish a Short Rest you can change up to a number of your prepared spells equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.QoCnmfrfioXyWIZ0]{Spell Interruption.} When you damage a creature that is Concentrating, that creature has Disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its Concentration.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Rxh3FP4xAAt8TcPN]{Universal Spell Focus.} If you have the Spellcasting Focus feature from a class you have levels in, that spellcasting focus becomes an applicable focus for all spells from any class and its bonuses, if any, are shared.

You are a master of fighting while mounted. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when fighting on horseback or another applicable mount.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8hhC2smeNrucguBt]{Cavalry Attack.} You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.fUp2TNIK47Wt1E1Q]{second time}, you also have advantage against unmounted creatures of equal size to your mount.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vYbgrVL37mRbo66f]{Durable Mount.} If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It may use your saving throw modifier if it is higher. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.H8ELV3rr7hpPsdXH]{second time}, your mount gains the same benefit against effects that allow it to make a Constitution saving throw.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9XSImATEXKrmSviI]{Lance Charge.} If your mount moves at least 10 feet towards an enemy on your turn and you use the attack action to attack that enemy with a lance, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you hit with your initial attack and have the extra attack feature, you may forgo your second attack and the hit is considered a critical hit and the enemy is knocked prone if they are no larger than your mount.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.C7fdX21nmd3PqhEE]{Mount Defender.} You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.SpClwQAn6gQ85s7T]{second time}, that attack is made with disadvantage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.EvmosSw3RcZhMhGy]{Mounted Combat Mastery.} If your mount is controlled, it is not restricted in the actions you can have it make. (normally a controlled mount is restricted to the Dodge, Dash or Disengage actions). If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.x2c3xyemYIT3IFRa]{second time}, you may control a mount even if it is not trained for combat.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Y848D4j8ZYtJkLAP]{Weapon Versatility.} You gain proficiency in the Lance, and two other martial weapons of your choice.

Prerequisite: A species that has a feature that provides them with Natural Weapons.

Special: When you reach character level 6, if you have taken two or more bullets from this feat, your Natural Weapon attacks can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

You are a master of fighting with the weapons nature has provided you. You've honed your anatomy to provide you with certain advantages when fighting with your natural weapons.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zBOkOtwJyQkZEsri]{Born to Hunt.} When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with your Natural Weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9Ybp8zyliI1k3jcV]{second time}, your Natural Weapons always deal bonus damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zmIBUgZmOQupNHI6]{Dire Fixation.} Your Natural Weapons can use both your Strength and Dexterity modifiers for the attack roll (as long as neither modifier is negative). If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.DyN7iltN5xxfsnxo]{second time}, your Natural Weapons can use both your Strength and Dexterity modifiers for the damage roll (as long as neither modifier is negative).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ARcS8HAwXjw9PQkX]{Honed Instincts.} Your natural weapons have the Finesse property.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8zbfcJcMngzabGGP]{Lash Out.} When you make an Opportunity Attack with your Natural Weapon, you can make another attack with your Natural Weapon as part of the same Opportunity Attack against any target within your Natural Weapon's reach.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.AmfvaXfbmfCu1Vig]{Mangle.} When you attack with your Natural Weapon, you can make an additional attack with your Natural Weapon as a Bonus Action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.7DTHQ8SR2At4C6wR]{Narrowed Focus.} When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll with your Natural Weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.TyZJRNjkU7FRD6L2]{second time}, your Natural Weapon attacks score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iOxKQjZCabrSmYR8]{Natural Fury.} Your Natural Weapon's damage die size is increased by one stage as shown in the Natural Fury table. You may select this bullet twice.

    Natural Fury Table
    Original Die SizeNew Die Size
    d4d6
    d6d8
    d8d10
    d10d12

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.D3TT9NWvEjYHBbV3]{Natural Weapon Mastery.} Once per turn, when you make an attack with a Natural Weapon you can apply one of the following Weapon Mastery properties for that attack: &Reference[Graze], &Reference[weaponMastery=push], or &Reference[Slow].

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9z8ItBBcRTo11Cm3]{Predatory Clarity.} You can add your Natural Weapon damage die to saving throws against Shoves and Grapples, all Athletics and Acrobatics skill checks, and Initiative rolls.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.dVVqtlmn1Tcy2Mly]{Prey on the Weak.} You make Opportunity Attacks with your Natural Weapon at Advantage. Additionally, other creatures provoke an Opportunity Attack from you if they receive the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition while in reach of your Natural Weapons.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.KxvIAo2ccoBkkvkY]{Primal Onslaught.} When you use a Bonus Action to attack using your Natural Weapon, you may make an additional attack with your Natural Weapon if you made more than one attack with your Natural Weapon on your turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.E05ZfAb3mxQOHavo]{Supernatural.} Your Natural Weapons meet the requirement for a melee weapon worth at least 1 silver (sp).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.JBB3sK1pfsUkdVpb]{Wild Momentum.} When you take the &Reference[Dash] action, you may make a Natural Weapon attack as part of that action.. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.OC94gfdmcPMlyk0C]{second time}, when you take the &Reference[Disengage] action, you may make a Natural Weapon attack as part of that action.

• @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.7Ci9jyLed8sh7L0g]{Combat Initiate.} Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you choose one Fighting Style Feat of your choice. If you already have a Fighting Style Feat, the one you choose for this feat must be different. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace this feat's Fighting Style Feat with another one that you do not have. You are required to forgo two of your feat bullets to select Combat Initiate.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.X5DLV0ngIRhCRZtj]{Combatant's Prowess.} Once on each of your turns, one of your attacks with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike that rolls additional die as part of the damage roll, can roll one additional die of the same time and add it to the total damage. If you roll multiple additional die than you choose which one you roll additionally.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jFbqACReUvFA6gzf]{Crushing Force.} Once per turn, when you hit a creature that is one size larger or smaller than you with an attack that deals Bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.MKojZivXYGvOwAPR]{Debilitating Attack.} When you score a critical hit that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has Disadvantage on all attack rolls and if it imposes a saving throw against a creature that creature has Advantage on the saving throw.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aFyEzQxCXfPSEEpP]{Deep Cuts.} Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Slashing damage, you can reduce the Speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.yP77mxUl9j74xawY]{Executioner.} When you score a Critical Hit that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die and add your attacking stats modifier an additional time when determining the extra damage the target takes.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.SkQTb5daeUBt6kME]{Lethal Dose.} You gain proficiency with the Poisoner's Kit. With one hour of work using such a kit and expending 25 GP worth of materials, you can create a number of poison doses equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You can apply this poison to a weapon or piece of ammunition as a Utilize action or in place of one of your attacks as part of the Attack action. Once applied, this poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you deal damage with the poisoned item, whichever is shorter. When a creature takes damage from the poisoned item, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Proficiency Bonus plus the ability modifier used) or take a number of d4s equal to your Proficiency Bonus as Poison damage and become &Reference[Poisoned] until the end of your next turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9UOYJgJ2VshHsINn]{Mortal Reminder.} When you score a Critical Hit that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with Advantage until the start of your next turn

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.BJeznvtcPUf1Xgaq]{Piercing Pain.} Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals Piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iqgR2nlJk8azzNsG]{Poisoner.} When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores Resistance to Poison damage. Also you can apply poison to a weapon as a Bonus Action or piece of ammunition as part of drawing or loading it, instead of an action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.5vxSWcfMcQtsfM4V]{Weapon Master.} Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of one kind of Simple or Martial weapon of your choice, provided you have proficiency with it. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change the kind of weapon to another eligible kind.

• @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ZAYYlKlJUHNCXvTy]{Alien Concentration.} Becoming &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] in any way other than the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition does not break your Concentration.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.wRJa3PyeJ7awgiND]{Ectopic Form.} You can choose to succeed on any saving throw that specifically targets your creature type, or any effect that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.isfBRGg25g06SNl4]{Extrasensory Awareness.} You are able to target creatures that are not protected from having their emotions sensed or thoughts read as though you can see them even if you cannot, as with casting spells, as long as they are within 60 feet of you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Qd32NMfTbNubmUfC]{Feedback.} When you cast a level 1+ spell that requires Concentration using a spell slot, you can target one creature that is also Concentrating within 30 feet of you. You can attempt to break the Concentration of that creature. They must succeed on a Concentration check against your spellcasting DC to maintain Concentration.

  • Mind Over Matter. Choose from @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.LMaKencnWhmGsjV1]{Intelligence}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.A5YPSHugdPhzCtSl]{Wisdom}, or @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.7ZcqO3tLvalqWjiw]{Charisma} as your ability modifier for this bullet when you select this bullet. When you would heal by spending Hit Dice, you can now use the chosen ability modifier in place of Consituttion when determining the amount healed. If you select this bullet a second time (@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.eTkwETPkCyN70qQI]{Intelligence}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.UTkNTzhdtWlSP1Db]{Wisdom}, or @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.EwFzqrXEBIAH0vdP]{Charisma}), you can now use the chosen ability modifier in place of Consitution to determine additional Hit Points per character level and you can use the saving throw of the chosen ability modifier to maintain Concentration instead of Constitution.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9BPVLcTQR0cWgvvo]{Psi-Shift.} When you take the &Reference[Dodge] action on your turn and your Speed is not 0, you can immediately teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 times your Proficiency Bonus feet. You can teleport in this way a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aCXnaxk2QzICRnGk]{Strange Vessel.} When you complete a Long Rest, select one of your abilities. Whenever you make a D20 Test that would not use your selected ability, you can instead choose to use that ability. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.LIZleaj68mNXf4hI]{Telekinetic Grasp.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand invisible. If you already know this spell, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it.

  • Telekinetic Reprisal. Choose from @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.CaPG37lMGY60junG]{Intelligence}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.iaPcl6cnIu9oGqSh]{Wisdom}, or @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.sg7d8x4Lf3P42Srb]{Charisma} as your spellcasting ability for this bullet (choose when you select this bullet). When you take damage from a creature that is within 5 times your Proficiency Bonus feet of you, you can tale a Reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Proficiency Bonus plus the chosen ability modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes twice your Proficiency Bonus Force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed. You can use this Reaction a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

  • Telekinetic Shove. Choose from @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ancDeofonDv6VBep]{Intelligence}, @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Ysv67LOlLKZxRm2g]{Wisdom}, or @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.JETzLXuK3aU5sfA5]{Charisma} as your spellcasting ability for this bullet (choose when you select this bullet). As a Bonus Action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Proficiency Bonus plus your chosne ability modifier) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.6CQnRMezQ6okiVYW]{Telepathic Probe.} You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can cast it this way again. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts} creatures have Disadvantage on any saving throw or ability check associated with your probing. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. If you have level 2+ spell slots, you can cast this spell with them.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kUdRcbBkNYNuvats]{Telepathic Utterance.} You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication does not give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically. If you select this bullet a second time, the range extends to 120 feet and they can reply.

You are a master in the art of ranged attacks in combat. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when using weapons that attack at range.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vRRvyT4bq0G6qMUq]{Careful Aim.} Attacking at long range does not impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls and thrown weapon attack rolls and your these attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.WZeB0fnsdr5WbPeN]{second time}, you may attack with your weapon up to twice the weapons maximum range, attacks over the maximum range of the weapon impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.m4us4RxUTKmp0x8b]{Deadly Aim.} Before you make a ranged attack with a weapon that you are proficient in and holding with two hands, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.oSbAlkPP0Dw6UXRB]{second time}, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your proficiency modifier to the attack roll, adding twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Nrj6Ol2tt37nFaCB]{Enfilade.} When a creature you can see hits or misses you with a ranged attack, you can use your reaction to make a ranged attack or thrown weapon attack with a weapon you are holding within the weapon's range against that creature immediately after its attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.XZSD583G2LlntION]{Fast Firing.} When you use the Attack action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one handed ranged weapon or thrown weapon that you are holding or may draw as part of the bonus action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.166PFnY8CSx7stuF]{Fast Loader.} You ignore the loading property of ranged weapons with which you are proficient.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Gv39SFAn4zrBiYHB]{Fast Thrower.} You may draw weapons with the thrown property as part of the attack with that weapon.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.uB8l97pV1Vm7aIkN]{Focused Aim.} Ranged weapon attacks and weapon attacks made with a weapon that has the thrown property are not made at disadvantage against prone targets, or made at disadvantage nor do they automatically fail due to combat underwater, passing through strong winds like the wind wall spell or similar effect (at the DM's discretion) if the attack is made within the weapons normal range.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ThZgX6aDJPARtAyN]{Fusillade.} When you take the Dodge action and are wielding a ranged weapon or a weapon with the thrown property, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack with that weapon against a creature that you can see that starts its turn or moves on its turn within normal range of that weapon.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.0ZfCfjgkfYhpWRoK]{Point Blank Shot.} Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature does not impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls and thrown weapon attack rolls.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8Cgmv9i88RuJ647I]{Sidearm.} While holding a ranged weapon or thrown weapon you can draw a melee weapon that has the light property to attack a creature that is within reach of the melee weapon. Alternatively you can use an unarmed strike. Immediately after this attack you may stow the melee weapon and draw and ready the previously held weapon.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8tSfV6b4VWvEwHBF]{Target Practice.} Once per turn when you roll damage for a ranged weapon attack or thrown weapon attack at normal range (as indicated on the weapon), you may roll the weapon's damage dice twice and select the better result. If you are adding additional dice to the damage roll (such as after scoring a critical hit or a sneak attack), those dice are rolled normally.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.nuIL15ZYdQ0PnTeK]{Weapon Versatility.} You gain proficiency in three ranged weapons or weapons with the thrown property.

Prerequisite: Strength 13 or higher

You are a crazed attacker on the battlefield. Your bloodlust has granted you certain advantages while fighting with unmatched zeal.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vURG4BOb7kztHFXt]{Abduct.} You can drag or carry a creature you have grappled without reducing your speed as long as the creature is the same size or smaller than you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Y6TW3otYwyKHDE34]{Athlete.} You gain proficiency in Athletics, if you are already proficient, you gain expertise.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.USl7HOK2i2CrwWSh]{Brutal Charge.} When you take the Dash action, move at least 10 feet in a straight line and end your movement within range of a target with a melee weapon you are holding or your unarmed strike, you may make an attack with that melee weapon or unarmed strike as part of the same action. If you chose to shove a creature with the attack action gained as part of a Dash, you may choose to shove the creature up to 10 feet and knock them prone with the same shove attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.J8tuP6GvXOZA0pHa]{Choke Hold.} Creatures grappled by you are unable to perform the Somatic components for spell casting and if they are concentrating (as if on a spell) they must succeed a concentration check (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + Proficiency Bonus) or lose concentration.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vyrtWzRyIoPCxarL]{Curtail.} If you deal damage with an attack using your Strength to a creature that has already taken their reaction, do not regain their reaction at the start of their next turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.j89PT1jpBMS7SWY0]{Grappler.} When you have a creature grappled, you can use your reaction when you are damaged by an attack to have the grappled creature take half of the damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vohtMydYztYnK34A]{Iron Grasp.} Creatures you have grappled have disadvantage on attack rolls.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.XmApSg7vkKRSyvyd]{Menacing.} When you are not incapacitated, the area in a 10 foot radius around you is considered difficult terrain for creatures of your choice. Creatures immune to the frightened condition are immune.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Gs8F8luZwasBsDDR]{Reversal.} If you are grappled by a creature that is your size or smaller, you may make a grapple attack against them and if you successfully grapple them, you are no longer grappled by them.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.uNjcHcjCveUxK6Xd]{Savage Attack.} Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you may roll the weapon's damage dice twice and select the better result. If you are adding additional dice to the damage roll (such as after scoring a critical hit or a sneak attack), those dice are rolled normally. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.llWoSwOt9RBk9w5Y]{second time}, you may inflict the maximum possible result of the weapon's damage dice rather than rolling.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.btZiBdD4FUcjII97]{Street Fighter.} You are proficient with improvised weapons and your unarmed strike uses a d4 for damage. Strength is your ability modifier for these attacks. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple or shove the target.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.IVdy7tLl6enAu0hA]{Sucker Punch.} If a creature takes at least 15 feet of movement without moving out of your reach of a melee weapon you are holding or unarmed strike, that creature provokes an opportunity attack from you.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.6Fgw9Dtt3prSCRxa]{Wrestler.} You may use a bonus action to grapple an opponent that is prone.

Your mind is always working, allowing you to notice the finer details, remember relevant facts, the speech and mannerisms of others, and process your thoughts quickly.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cJpwnQ1toKrUHUcQ]{Arcane Intellect.} You understand the nature of magic, allowing you to identify spells when cast by a spellcaster. If you perceive a spell being cast, the spell's effect, or both, you can make an Intelligence (Arcana) check to identify the spell being cast. The DC equals 15 + the spell's level. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.DGMmiq8qbuTvAHiK]{second time}, you make the roll with advantage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.yHaC8Gb9LZtOqTvc]{Intuitive Assessment.} If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to it's Intelligence and Wisdom scores. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.OjqMLs5i53Oj0JrR]{second time}, you may know precisely the Intelligence and Wisdom scores of an observed creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ps0M06It9mQsbl8Z]{Lip Reader.} If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips. In addition, you can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.HR8OQV6fXW9UeBCN]{Perfect Memory.} You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset, and you always know which way is north, you have advantage on any ability checks to avoid getting lost, in addition, you can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.7NcJQP30o0cpLNh4]{second time}, your memory becomes so acute you can accurately recall even the most finite details of anything you have seen or heard within the last month to the point that you could duplicate a key or a spellbook that you have observed.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.G9lWXycflToCp8Zy]{Versatile Intellect.} Whenever you make a Wisdom ability check, you may substitute your Intelligence score if it is higher.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ggDhgSswMpnU1yKd]{Versatile Intuition.} Any time you make an Intelligence ability check, you may substitute your Wisdom score if it is higher.

You are a master of fighting with one handed melee weapons and versatile weapons. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing these weapons.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4ehtCMB6DUUdkW23]{Close Quarters Fighting.} After making an attack with the benefit of your proficiency modifier against a creature within 5 feet with a melee weapon you are holding in one hand, you may use your bonus action to make a shove or grapple attack with your free hand. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.osMSkY3hhk8i6E3O]{second time}, the bonus action may be used to make an unarmed strike. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d4 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you select this bullet) bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal for an unarmed strike. This unarmed strike can be made with natural weapons instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.yLpA5AguM5h6PPD2]{Deadly Swing.} Before you make an attack roll with a melee weapon with the versatile property you are wielding in one hand, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kLCd66JavRoxNP4z]{second time}, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your proficiency modifier to the attack roll, adding twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.f5yYm0fQMWIMInKR]{Disable.} Before you make a melee attack with a weapon that you are proficient with, and you are holding nothing in your other hand, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, the target of the attack suffers disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.5nttzAMqYYojw31U]{second time}, the target of the attack suffers disadvantage on its next two weapon attack rolls it makes before the end of its next turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.rmwi6bhRMZfzBHSk]{Extended Reach.} When you make an attack roll with a melee weapon with the versatile property and holding nothing in your other hand, you may make a one handed attack as if the weapon had the reach property. If the weapon has a special property that gives it reach you do not reduce the weapons damage die.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.irn5k7DOxpwbHvJf]{Garde.} When you use a melee weapon one handed, and nothing in the other, and you are hit with an attack you can use your reaction to take the Dodge action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.UXcN2bU0n3OD7dvW]{Nimble Warrior.} When you use a melee weapon one handed, and nothing in the other, it is treated as if it had the finesse property.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.NNZWlIUKpVAQyyIc]{Parry Attack.} When you are wielding a weapon with which you are proficient and no other weapons or shields in the other hand, and another creature hits you with a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss. you. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ES8RELWWYbOfofdT]{second time}, after you use this feature, you retain a +2 to your AC against weapon attacks and unarmed strikes until the beginning of your next turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.973OAbtmSkqfBuQ1]{Singularly Focus.} Once per turn when you roll damage with a melee weapon with the versatile property you are wielding in one hand, you may roll the weapon's damage and any additional damage dice twice and select the better result.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.agle4pmkKxLagmis]{Weapon Versatility.} You gain proficiency in three one handed weapons of your choice.

You are an expert at skulking and scouting in dangerous locations, like dungeons, dark hallways in an enemy lair, or caverns.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.sRbn8Exb2wIHDOzQ]{Alert Traveler.} Traveling at a fast pace doesn't impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Wisdom (Perception) score.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.mIFgUTynnoBsTFMC]{Easily Overlooked.} While you are in dim light or darkness and an enemy attempts to target you using their sight to impose a saving throw against you, they must succeed on a Perception check (DC equal to 10 + half your character level) to do so. On a failure, they must pick a new target. If they are unable to pick another target and you were the sole target, they lose their action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.eqN27CAEA6qkWp6j]{Hazard Avoidance.} You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps and other environmental hazards (at your DMs Discretion), and you have resistance to the damage dealt by traps and other environmental hazards (at your DMs Discretion).

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YdRHLro6YATuLa72]{Hidden Sniper.} When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack does not reveal your position. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.x9AgTpYhOAPOGwMS]{second time}, you may use your reaction to make another hide check if your position is revealed after hitting with a ranged weapon attack.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9lxENblKjkh9WuPY]{Inevitability.} When you hit a creature while being unseen to them or when the creature is surprised, you can force them to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + proficiency bonus + the ability modifier used). On a failed saving throw the creature is frightened and considers all unoccupied spaces around it as the source of its fear even if they cannot see.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jOVaZCe9ugmBN7LH]{Inventive Sneaking.} You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.ggiCzwoD1xt4Ba4f]{Premeditation.} Your attack rolls are made at advantage against surprised creatures during the initial round they are surprised. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.0fs7764GkYroXRYW]{second time}, their saving throws are made a disadvantage vs DCs you impose upon them while they are surprised.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Yz3yOvuUCX6iOB6g]{Preparation.} Creatures that you surprise have disadvantage on initiative rolls, and are only able to take an action or a bonus action on their subsequent turn, not both.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.bUx5vZ8RedfUqtn2]{See in the Shadows.} Dim light does not impose disadvantage on your Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.HHtO8ZjT1ANqU4zy]{second time}, you may see in darkness as if you had darkvision (60 feet), or if you already have darkvision, the range is increased by 30 feet.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.dbdnOUEAePrNx0Gk]{Sharp Hearing.} You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sound.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.kzcnTOVKGf5Nf2IC]{Soothing Darkness.} While you are in dim-light or darkness, creatures do not have advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of you being affected by a condition.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Vchh9VzSMON3iLVn]{Stealthy.} You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill, if you already have proficiency, you gain expertise. If you select this bullet a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.uPl3GDwYezgotQxe]{second time}, moving stealthily does not hamper your movement.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.Fcg2yDTzn61beCYm]{Subterfuge.} When you hit a creature within normal range of a ranged attack, to a maximum of 30 feet, if they are affected by a condition that allows any attack that hits the creature to be a critical hit if the attack is within 5 feet of the creature then you critically hit.

You have a knack for surviving the most harrowing of situations, and you have a talent for keeping those in your care alive.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.MZzA4CfzE7fgJM50]{Combat Medic.} When you use a healer's kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vM9NHyCcoHomiHJe]{Doctor.} As an action, you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore 1d6 + 4 hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.zR73IDkOsa7SPfg5]{Fortunate.} You have a luck point. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend the luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend your luck point after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose whether to use your roll or the initial result. You can also spend your luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or yours. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled. You regain your expended luck point when you finish a long rest. You may select this bullet more than once.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.uuttElEQ9zwnuNyB]{Inspiring Leader.} You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to your proficiency bonus friendly creatures other than yourself within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to half your level (rounded up). If at least one creature gains temporary hit points in this way then so do you. A creature cannot gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest. If you select this bullet @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.jymMls9H0baUojwh]{twice}, the temporary hit points are equal to your level. If you select this bullet @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.4l6Ba8BN6KYLb6zY]{three times}, the temporary hit points are equal to your level + your Charisma modifier.

In combat you are careful and employ enhanced tactics that make you especially deadly.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.laDEIfEWCQyhxWX0]{Astute.} When you take the Attack action on your turn you may substitute one of the attacks with the Help action.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.k6plgChY4uHy7hMZ]{Combat Tactician.} You learn a maneuver of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master Archetype in the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). You gain one superiority die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuver. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You may select this bullet more than once, each additional selection provides one additional maneuver known and d6 superiority die.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.yrddEYS5e8N3Ogl2]{Disabling Strike.} When you hit a creature that is one size category larger or smaller than you with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.vlr0HP3ip7Tkh1yB]{In Their Face.} When a hostile creature makes a ranged attack roll within reach of a weapon you are holding or your unarmed strike, they have disadvantage on the attack roll.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.YIo2tpRSioRB7vHA]{Leverage Surroundings.} When making a ranged attack, you gain a bonus to the attack roll equal to the bonus AC you would have due to cover from attacks that would be made by the opponent at its current position. If you would have total cover from this opponent, your bonus is treated as if you have three-quarters cover.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.F3mqK6AEXE3zSa26]{Opportunist.} When a creature within range of a melee weapon you are holding or your unarmed strike makes an attack against a target other than you (and that target doesn't have this feat), you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike against the attacking creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.3jNWb2iklYgbFpWZ]{Reposition.} When you take the Dodge action, and a creature misses you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to move up to your speed.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.W36iPV0sqhs1VTL8]{Sentinel.} Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.8nC7kEsDntLlsTu2]{Thwart.} On your turn, when you score a critical hit or reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can immediately attempt to hinder other threats around you. A number of creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you or the target equal to your proficiency modifier must make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 8 + proficiency bonus + the ability modifier used) or become hindered until the end of their next turn. While hindered a creature cannot take reactions and can only take an action or a bonus action, not both. You may only impose the saving throw from Thwart once per turn on a creature.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.74b3e9bSVYqdxBil]{Weight of Attacks.} Once per turn, if you take the Attack action on your turn and have advantage on an attack roll against one of the targets, you can forgo the advantage for that roll to allow a creature of your choice within reach of their melee weapon attack or unarmed strike to use their reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the same target. They must be able to see or hear you.

You are a worker of wonders and performer of minor miracles. The source of your abilities can be heritage, from intensive training, exposure to another plane of existence, or something entirely different that has granted you a broad array of potential benefits.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.9kTox5AgbkjflwoZ]{Concealment.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.eP8ZCXxlGFJzKIUz]{Pass without Trace} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.cXKluszYN2IvlgxV]{Disjoint.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.D6QGbgwR1uWDoYE4]{Misty Step} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.SMSh8hhr0kN4FH09]{Fortoken.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.iAv1Ojc3wU5UGMVP]{Augury} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.aasFscUPo1SsgAnZ]{Halcyon.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.e3HVFpfUVeG4SmOx]{Calm Emotions} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.HJEf3wrBSwcs04dW]{Imperceptible.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.5N4WSDlJs070kOZB]{Invisibility} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.pEj1F5pZOFVPWxeO]{Ingress.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.LX7Cz7jm0pnDwlvm]{Knock} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.J2AwDLPxq7ixj10p]{Lucidum.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.JxQOGWuvP28suqhx]{Darkvision} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.UqUk4Z7u791I2DCB]{Malleable.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.YKuiZHu4pS6zMdUS]{Enlarge/Reduce} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.

  • @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.feats.Item.QuEtzcYVqL9ft8tP]{Mesmer.} You learn the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.yY9XIEOildIsv3qP]{Mirror Image} spell which may be used with your Thaumaturge charges.
